document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

E4224DE935304C3282AA1524090557CC.description:
Realize we are all called to proclaim the
Good News of Jesus Christ by the way we live and act.

81EE7B56A9A24935B025FC84F67B91DB.description:
Identify God’s chosen people as the
descendants of Abraham, which is the common heritage of
Jews, Christians and Muslims.

48FD6441D77F479285EC26308E5D85BF.description:
Recognize Muslims as those who
reverence God and who adhere to the religion of Islam.

44F25DAE04D54F87B2508AE9AB8A3CA4.description:
Recognize that Jews and Muslims share
our belief in one God (Monotheism).

6F85AE970B844D20AE73A77599E29035.description:
State the importance of respecting the
religious beliefs of others.

1BE42ED661D54427A2D293BB2451A972.description:
Define ecumenism as the call for
Christian unity.

52E7B8FD511A48F4BECCD54819C5B4E5.description:
Understand that the mission of the
Church is evangelization.

41A697E7B2FB4BA6AC30018A37F9C9EB.description:
CALL
TO ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION
[848-849, 927-933, 905,
2044, 2472]

45F9C51DF2674FCFA3BB01D333D5C1F3.description:
Describe the ways that the Archdiocese and
the parish serves the poor and vulnerable, e.g. CRS.

12E7F6E1C49B4FB59627268D2A48073A.description:
Identify the many ways that each person has
the responsibility to share time, talents and treasure with the
Church.

010AE3DA0A7446089E3C88E486682B5C.description:
Reflect on service and stewardship as each
relates to justice.

CED0215BD20943FE88356E1EA0F74886.description:
Define the role of steward as one who
receives and shares God’s gifts wisely.

EAF2D4711D644936A6196129123F508F.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
social teaching about
the common good
[2149-2422]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-2:3; 2:7-25

749124E3D5DF4970B43A8F1DA340C6A5.description:
Articulate our Baptismal call to serve God
and our community by sharing our gifts.

54A2E8B759EF4434AA258518F0A93B12.description:
Realize we are all called to proclaim the
Good News of Jesus Christ by the way we live and act.

23458C6EF59641479EE2378C15AE0271.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816,849]
Scripture:
Mt. 28:18-20

345B20682F774D199D76F6C235300DC4.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6: THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

FC89814D4DBB40A0858F4101FB81EF41.description:
Know the meaning of the Immaculate
Conception.

106F282B2D2D40908ED59343D546EC2F.description:
Articulate how Mary can be an example of a
life of virtue and discipleship.

75AE614C36874961BEBAD844436D6648.description:
Know some approved apparitions of Blessed
Virgin: Our Lady of Lourdes, Our Lady of Fatima, and Our
Lady of Guadalupe.

4898EEC0DFA04B9DB467089FD2BCC10B.description:
Know the solemnity and feast days in honor
of Our Lady.

FB5B989999224EA09933BB712678DBBE.description:
Review and articulate titles of Mary: e.g.,
The Immaculate Conception, Our Lady of Guadalupe,
example of faith, example of holiness, Our Lady of Notre
Dame. (Resource: Litany of Loreto)

3BB70A61B70A4378BCD0C53B3D82425B.description:
Know that each of us is called to be a saint and
to be a part of the Communion of Saints.

72B98809CE3A41A39537E69B71ECB132.description:
Know the stories of holy men and women who
were active in the Pacific Northwest Church.

6F2788913F8F4A758CCDED4756CA11BF.description:
Celebrate the feast day of the parish patron
saint.

6A8286799D5648D98CCFD938316B9B79.description:
Recognize and tell the stories of some of the
Saints of the Church who model the Beatitudes.

E1022FF896D34DBBB273AE9D2C37607A.description:
Show understanding that vocations are ways
to holiness in life.

81A6F094CA3B425C9DF06F50F05300B4.description:
Identify ways each can be a witness to God’s
love and also serve others.

F2A431FA4EBF4072924067D8257154DE.description:
Articulate how living a moral life prepares them
to hear God’s vocational call.

7A040D5260DF408E807D617E2517BF48.description: Pray for faithfulness in one’s vocation.

01CA4174C38047A1AF1AA8F206AB7EA5.description:
Define vocations as a call to serve God and
one another.

9F79E82E0F8F4DCEAA6AC2D6212AD362.description:
Vocation:
Marriage, priesthood
[914-933] Scripture
1 Pet. 2:9
1 Sam. 3:1-10
Is. 6:1-8
Mt. 9:10:13
Mk. 1:16-20

DFD1203CD6B044338A320F1B3AC8BA62.description:
Explain in own words how God’s gift of
grace will help them live a moral, holy life.

467FF7E748C740E5B20D0850554814CC.description:
Define Fruits of the Holy Spirit. (Fruits of the
Holy Spirit are developed over time as we live out the Gifts of
the Holy Spirit.)

6E5DBEE4DC314D34A81712306D9880D1.description:
Define Gifts of the Holy Spirit. (Gift – freely
given to those in a state of grace.)

46E61B46AE91432DAB7CFD17A9CB05A9.description:
Name and explain why the Gifts and Fruits of
the Holy Spirit helps us become closer to God and grow in
holiness.

8A6D6161BA914E03AE42F57B1A7B7C88.description:
The
Universal Call to
Holiness
[2013-2014,2028,2813]
Scripture
1 Pet. 1:15-16
Lev. 11:44

1E30D700B59B419B8FF82648A88B8832.description:
Recall the definition and give examples of
family as the domestic church.

6C775139FA75410DBD98B16F342A8066.description:
Associate ways the Precepts of the Church
help one grow in holiness and awareness of the needs of
others.

5420AF62F32A401D9D946DA5ED3EDDFC.description:
Understand that the role of the Church is a
guide for the formation of one’s conscience throughout life.

69A9F4A376C04E42B53B7C51F3973307.description:
Recognize that as members of a parish we
have responsibilities that we call stewardship.

806AFBD57F534D49B14C9C770049FEF3.description:
Explain how the parish is part of the Catholic
Church and that as members of the Catholic Church we
belong to a parish.

D4A7CD6B695541E0BF4617EE6BCBD2A4.description:
Recognize that the Church teaches through
bishops, pastors, teachers, and catechists.

4A2D3D6951F14B46992F4991ED4DB5EB.description: Identify a pastor as the head of the parish.

CC5FFC4861474C118671381674CCCFCC.description:
Name the current Holy Father, Pope, as head
of the Catholic Church and the archbishop who leads the
archdiocese.

7C1F8D0C763C404387B15452D8D74044.description: Recognize that the Church is hierarchical.

1BB3D5ECAE5E427688315D5E8970D1AA.description:
Church
Order: The Hierarchy
and Magisterium and
Infallibility
[874-896]

E316F798AB7A44A18C8B968B6C5BF291.description:
CHRIST’S
FAITHFUL:
HEIRARCHY, LAITY,
CONSECRATED LIFE:
[871-945]

226378E4DBA849D6B89298A5FBECD0E0.description:
Locate and share the four Marks of the
Church within the Nicene Creed..

8481B65CF88E4C85BA5D9ADC67626037.description:
MYSTERY
AND MARKS OF THE
CHURCH: One, Holy,
Catholic and Apostolic
[811-870]

059D2DB424FC4918A9685301E0A7403E.description:
Realize the obligation of being made in
God’s image by taking care of my body as the “Temple of
the Holy Spirit.”

4EA921F822ED4127BAFC40C52C448BFB.description:
Describe the Temple of the Holy Spirit
as God’s Holy Spirit living in me and inspiring me to do what
is good.

C116507390B948A1A1CCD486EAAF2A48.description:
Temple of
the Holy Spirit
[797-801]
Scripture:
1 Cor. 6:19-20

D63AC8BB6BA742CB9DD36211FA859736.description:
Recognize and understand the purpose of
Catholic Charities as reaching out to serve and support all
the members of the Body of Christ.

6FD7DFB594A44812AC4E332FDEAAE51F.description:
Explain the Body of Christ as the Church in
heaven and on earth.

7D795106E114480189239435F927FCB0.description:
Articulate how their parish helps those in
need as the Body of Christ.

696D9417C979480DBEED05506562CA30.description:
Identify the Church community as the
People of God who commit to leading holy and moral lives.

AF7F933FE0154C47B9A10C1EBA6CC0FA.description:
Understand that the Church helps us grow in
our relationship with God and as a community committed to
serving others.

0C843C5D85FA48EEA84BBC5917C635A5.description:
Recall how Jesus Christ established the
Church and remains its head on heaven and earth.

C7924629BC134B79803F9584FD617F62.description:
THE CHURCH
IN GOD’S PLAN
[748-780]
Church History
[758-780
Scripture:
Acts 2:1-13

2A997E45EC434032AB3AEF24B6CC627F.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 5: THE LIFE, COMMUNITY AND HISTORY OF THE CHURCH: Students study and participate in the life and mission of the church, the Body of
Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic church.

262219CD10454FE8BC63DDC0BAED8430.description: Agnus Dei / Behold the Lamb of God

9A1949EE548D403B995B546C3692D925.description:
Responses after all Lectionary readings and
before Gospel

F84247395F4B48798793E94737A24ECF.description:
Invitatory, Psalm(s) antiphonal style and Doxology
from the Liturgy of the Hours – Psalm 51

F075680637C84D27B0B2A5483F091E0B.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise,
intercession, thanksgiving, petition

3D1D8DBCE22346B080652CC42651B387.description:
PRAYERS WE
KNOW BY HEART,
EXPERIENCE AND
SHARE AT MASS

9A7F3438CE704EFBBE42CFF96504090B.description: State how we pray with Mary and the Saints.

BBED28FD141144D99E5EABC08BD01309.description:
Identify the four different sets of the mysteries of
the rosary.

7D286126842C4F719487BD2421DAA6F4.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
Rosary, Stations of the
Cross, Novenas)
[1200-1209, 1674-1679,
2683-2696]

DE38B89C2D4642A4858DFF8D0140E4B0.description: Identify the Seven Petitions in the Our Father.

6D82D826B90648D185993E2F79958BA3.description:
OUR FATHER:
Summary of the Gospel
[2746-2865]
Scripture:
Mt. 6:9-13
Lk. 11:1-13

A45904EC02D1428E93C832716596FCCA.description:
Engage in the four stages of Lectio Divina. (See
resources.)

4B9AE94664FD4F128562694B3506443B.description:
Know various prayer expressions including the
Jesus prayer and choral prayer.

A0FB9C2572FB4676BD98B089DE968A7C.description: Participate in a variety of traditional devotions.

78EFB715D0204173A90CDCF3177DB246.description:
Experience how personal prayer can help them in
making moral decisions.

27CAFD9862394C66952A6840CE3B297F.description:
EXPRESSIONS
OF PRAYER (vocal
meditation,
contemplation,
personal and shared)
[2700-2724]

11C4B8FF89BC4B5F83F325905F8E46C8.description:
Know and use aspirations with the common
response of “pray for us.”

26F03384B160408687019F88EE360442.description:
State that God is faithful and loving no matter the
circumstances of human life.

3E1839690F814591858E0AE49B9EAFBB.description:
Explain why it is important to pray to the Holy
Spirit for guidance in making moral decisions.

8A51E586829848AC959CA51DBC19D18E.description: Articulate how and when to pray.

87D752A35CDD4C79B7C7D47BB9673216.description:
Experience and participate in a number of
different prayer forms: prayers of blessing, adoration,
petition, intercession, thanksgiving, praise.

35F240B4E00D4C51BF02C1F3CAAB4C16.description:
FORMS OF
PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]
Scripture:
Psalms

B2A6BAA6DC014DDD826D115602566A13.description:
Describe prayer as raising our hearts and minds
to God.

507E98695BD64D6BA98341DBAF967B41.description:
Know that prayer is essential to our life with God
and part of Christian life.

78CD9FADFF6041FCA0BAA7BCC6E325C0.description:
THE UNIVERSAL
CALL TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER
[2558-2758]
Scripture:
Mt. 6: 5-15

4F63E4EA4E544772A1CDA79FDA640153.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship with God and the Church.

0FB7BA9905F84AC98A5C7C52803CDCB0.description:
Participate in age-appropriate service projects
and share reflections on our call to discipleship and building
God’s Kingdom.

E3B7257AA9E945649335A2256128B8E0.description:
Know and provide examples of the Seven
Corporal Works of Mercy.

7F46ACDEDD92447989EC4F033D1260E0.description:
Know and provide examples of the Seven
Spiritual works of Mercy.

05D66BAD8C434648B4DF9C7B673FF308.description: Articulate respect for the dignity of all work.

54C722B5648C467BA65D33EBE4A65E63.description:
Describe the importance of work and how it is
a participation in God’s life.

6DBE4D80818D47CC85189AB7518BB901.description:
Distinguish between the terms poor and
vulnerable.

5FA3BE61923041968FE41AA603C643D5.description:
Develop awareness of the needs of the poor in
local areas.

E448802AC7C2411C8ABD563BC28FA4E8.description:
Demonstrate care of personal belongings,
classroom, school building, and parish grounds.

4984088E1FD540EDA1910242248F1828.description:
Describe and demonstrate how not to waste
God’s gifts of food and natural resources.

FC4449AC35D942D2BEF6C48A5BBF3C83.description:
Catholic
Social Teachings –
Consistent Ethic of
Life, Love of Neighbor,
and the Corporal and
Spiritual Works of
Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-18; 2: 1-25

02F2D63B016648888081062EB1A2BC67.description:
Understand the concept of hell as the state of
self exclusion from God because of the lack of contrition for
and absolution from mortal sin.

1061E2F417D84F91851B2DC13893895C.description:
Understand purgatory a process after death
for a person who has sinned; those experiencing purgatory
are certain of heaven.

FB7A3016C0D44C0992419E4EF807C666.description:
Understand God’s forgiveness and describe
ways we have experienced this healing.

AC92633D49D349559DE818B07CF00AFD.description:
Show understanding of the reality of sin and its
consequences in the world.

DCD62E806AC94ED88C2D1FE21C01CF59.description:
Recall that personal sin can have different
degrees such as venial or mortal.

C1E7B869A1804143BD42C90D9B5FE175.description:
Identify and understand the origins of sin,
Original Sin, as given in the Old Testament creation
accounts.

786A288B6E2D4C4C829251D584DD5A1F.description:
Define sin in relation to our thoughts, words
and actions.

8654F33D260C49369D7F2F2A5544A5AE.description:
Personal and
Social Sin
[1846-1876]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25;3:1-24; 4:1-
16

9DC8ED5596EB402ABB83D79C81BDC2D7.description:
Make connections between the terms justice
and human dignity.

6B65A57293454FD9BD0BF4CC879C190E.description:
Articulate why we have a duty to treat others as
we wish to be treated.

EDF7B92CF7FF4CFEA85CFAC07A03C326.description:
Acknowledge the unique importance of each
person.

2720FCAF75ED45169C830182210F4D4A.description:
THE HUMAN
COMMUNITY
[1877-1948, 2204-2213]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25; 3:1-24
Lk. 15: 11-32

E2052BD33A1F43B7B3E23EB874187FA6.description:
Define what it means to be a “disciple,”
building on the Theological Virtues of Faith, Hope and
Charity (love).

F33A25B4D5B048469F078AF8EE784E45.description:
Name and define the Cardinal Virtues as
ways of living as disciples of Jesus: prudence, justice,
fortitude and temperance.

13BCC8DBFE534F0587246E40F6533E4F.description:
Virtues
Cardinal and
Theological
[1803-1845, 2656-2662]
Scripture:
Col. 1:9-14
Ph. 4:4-9
Prov. 19:1

08AED98BA3724A0CB1D39B76C8219377.description:
Understand that the first three
Commandments are about our relationship with God and
the last seven are about our relationship with other people.

3E6AAA94028E4990A48ACC1052B34B5A.description:
Recite the Ten Commandments and be able to
rephrase with examples from our lives.

7DB92CC74BDA4B99A30136D205670C09.description:
Know God revealed the covenant to Moses
on Mount Sinai.

4206BEFEC4CE46B2A6F5DEB9718711E1.description:
Covenant and
Ten Commandments
[2052-2557]
Scripture:
Ex. 19: 16-20 – 20:17
Ex. 24:1-12
Mt: 22:34-40
Mk. 12:28-34

B08AE4037D254615A4DC0878FE0CBBEF.description:
Demonstrate how to examine one’s
conscience using the Ten Commandments, Beatitudes
and Works of Mercy.

5EE3EE4F4E2D4979B18DADE7C9221AEE.description:
Define conscience, and explain how
throughout our lives, it is formed and developed through the
Sacrament of Reconciliation.

5AFF7C98195F41C09B640C990F68156E.description:
Demonstrate a moral decision making
process, and how we can ask God to help us make moral
choices.

F24A83A52C89457D89280205D7DB718B.description:
Explain how living a moral life means that
they take into account how their actions/thoughts/words
affect others.

FE35D7A37FA04D8E90A583ABD69A2921.description:
Identify three sources of human choice:
object, intention and circumstances.

C2E3E6D5CD614F3283AAA837B1BCF3F4.description:
Recognize that God creates human beings:
body and soul having intellect and free will.

ED21E0B7E00F41199B44AFE70CE3D6F8.description:
List and define the fruits of the Holy Spirit:
charity, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, long
suffering, mildness, faith, modesty, continence and
chastity.

A54517F1F7624B5894822E3D22DE01B7.description:
Apply the Beatitudes to moral vignettes and to
the way they are living their lives

C084090109974E31A0A9ACA8A8914F93.description:
Explain how the Beatitudes fulfill the Ten
Commandments.

A54C89244FCA41D6A87836BF6FC3D6A6.description:
Locate the Beatitudes in Scripture and
explain how to practice them in our lives.

292FE4BADB1F4933825BBC6DF47D1B7B.description:
Understand that God created us as naturally
good and destined for union with Him.

BD6FD4ADE72E4B68948DF6A7A016EDAE.description:
Made for
Happiness with God,
Beatitudes
[1218-1229, 1716-1717]

7AD700CAE47849159EFD6ADC55F1113E.description:
Understand that God created us in His image
with a unique body and unique soul, therefore all human life
is sacred.

5B1546BA22BB4E9A90AB2AC4EA769A0B.description:
Made in the
Image of God –
Foundation of Human
Dignity
[355-368, 1004, 1700-
1876]
Scripture
1 Cor. 6:19-20

D3076030227A443B90467FEA91733A57.description:
Describe how God created us naturally good
with a desire and a capacity to know Him and love Him.

FC9B415972AA4C7FA8AEF51A1F23FBD3.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3 – MORALITY / LIFE IN CHRIST: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ, as modeled
in a personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society.

1C720160EBAC4F84A0AC713A5A15CAA0.description:
Connect the symbols of eternal life in Christ
with Baptism and Christian funerals.

795A093BE6B4491E9589C87B2B6EC8D9.description:
Recall that Christian funerals are a
celebration of our life in Christ.

B061E249FCD646E296C013944B4FD9C2.description:
Recall that Holy Matrimony is a sacrament
that takes place in a church with special blessings for the
couple.

56FA3777643E4FAE892EF4E6CE23C035.description:
Liturgical Rites:
Weddings, [1621- 1637]
Funerals [988-1029, 1680-1690]
and Blessings [1671-1673

A71462BD5ABA4DB3A8FA3E45FC75A3D4.description:
Pray psalms from the Liturgy of the Hours
and explain how they can deepen our relationship with
God.

76708C767DF9463195FD392C1A90D42C.description:
With the teacher and classmates,
antiphonally recite and pray Psalm 51.

C87AE58A38104BDD8BCA2B2CDF711D5C.description:
Recall the response to the invitatory with the
Sign of the Cross and “Lord open my lips” and “And my
mouth will proclaim your praise.

38CF3CF3591943E2BCBD55431F657B55.description:
Locate psalms found in the Liturgy of the
Hours.

67C6F64C89384EAABC722F5E79BEFC03.description:
Divine Office
Liturgy of the Hours
[1174-1178]
Scripture:
Psalms 23, 67 and 51

C60FFF3ED253404FA606C5024C4E4EE4.description:
State the meaning of a sacramental, and
incorporate sacramentals into daily life.

01ACFE26DB144A40A812D6A56363D7D4.description:
Know the celebrations of Holy Week
identifying the important days of the Triduum.

2F454AE4EDA94ACC90BDDE4918A76E82.description:
Review the concept of Ordinary Time, and
associate it with the teachings and public life of Jesus.

56C9435263D74582AF7FCC4837E39D47.description:
Describe the relationship of the Liturgical
Year with the life of Jesus Christ.

C4A827BED6ED4AABB8CBA4E610156137.description:
Recognize the significance of liturgical
celebrations including: Trinity Sunday, Corpus Christi -
the Feast of Body and Blood of Christ, and the
Solemnity of the Sacred Heart.

0817A0BA1E2D49A1AB6CAC7139A1D997.description:
Identify the holy days of the Church
Calendar.

692E79B4E32A4527BD5D9252D0964D2C.description:
Recall the seasons of the Liturgical Year,
their significance, and the liturgical color.

B8247C519B584A3CB0855BE1F974115E.description:
Identify sacraments in service of communion:
Marriage and Holy Orders; people who receive these
sacraments help others.

BAFC6F3E387340B7A988CE40F5E4FA42.description:
Sacraments at the
Service of Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture:
Ex. 19:16-20:17

FD986058B7C24EBBB8552ACF4E1BD956.description:
Explain the importance of performing penance
as part of the Sacrament of Penance / Reconciliation.

6A92DC87D36F42DAA72123C130DFFB2D.description:
Understand that contrition is a gift from God
and a prompting of the Holy Spirit to acknowledge sorrow
for our sins with the intention of sinning no more.

0AF49A1D3F834D428CCF553769638CB8.description:
Explain why it is important to participate in the
Sacrament of Reconciliation/Penance frequently.

A70D6FC35E104679A6E7243BFAD6F600.description:
Examine and articulate God’s forgiveness and
hope for reconciliation through the reading of a parable
and from their own experience. (Prodigal Son)

6CED354547144F8DA6FB69ABF53F6F2D.description:
Name the essential components of the
Sacrament of Penance/Reconciliation.

3FFD5C5A2C354DFE9ADF50C0B1034791.description:
Understand the Sacrament of Penance /
Reconciliation as Sacraments of Healing.

43CAE461901E49D5929E2FE43A77D9CF.description:
Sacraments of Healing
[979-987, 1420-1484]]
Scripture:
Gen. 37:1-36; 45:1-28
Lk. 15:11-32

5302996967DF48B38A52A65856104D3B.description:
Examine and explain what special gifts one
receives through the Sacrament of Confirmation: Gifts of
the Holy Spirit, Fruits of the Holy Spirit.

9CC70549EC85478AA1B4CB1F30066C39.description:
Recognize that participation in the Mass through
the Penitential Act and in reception of the Holy Eucharist
is the ordinary means of the forgiveness of venial sins.

21F3D010CD34426E80114A08D0450778.description:
Demonstrate understanding that the Eucharist is
the source and summit of Christian life.

DE11BF33F06F4770ADCEFBCDCA30D5D5.description:
Connect their Baptism with the call to live a
moral life.

D5996807A2FE4AC5A329DF63A2B18C46.description:
List and describe the Sacraments of Initiation:
Baptism, Eucharist and Confirmation.

1F01E0CED32D40E680C55EB6D1302944.description:
Sacraments of Initiation
[966-977, 1212-1419]
Scripture:
Ex. 19:16-20:17
Mt. 26:25-30; 27
Jn. 3:1-21

EF8B246029694A388A87AA0DFF859555.description:
Explain in own words how God’s gift of grace will
help them live a moral life.

87191F2837E346218627473484734D71.description:
Identify the ways we encounter God through the
sacraments.

B0EC795A3AF946669554418B512B0D0D.description:
CELEBRATION OF THE
SACRAMENTS
[1210-1666]
Scripture
Acts 15: 10-11
1 Cor. 15:10

5965EEE9158C41DB98D0825C564F356A.description:
With guidance from the teacher, as a class,
prepare a liturgy based on a chosen theme or feast day.
Include in the preparation: readings, intercessory prayers
and music.

3FC07DEA194A4156AA0F8AC204DEBAB6.description:
Describe the roles of the priest, deacon, lector,
ministers of Communion and acolytes in the Mass.

269D8AFAFDB64113B8F0EF4870497049.description:
Understand the term and concept of
transubstantiation and associate it with the Real
Presence of Christ in the Eucharist.

5F6ED9469AA84F618093E0EC8DC04A4F.description:
Understand how to create prayers of intercession
for the Eucharistic liturgy.

9755BC2903B740F3AB24ED645C251CC7.description: Recognize the Eucharistic Prayers used at Mass.

DD83E96B84C9468F8C26E91FA2B203BF.description:
Recognize that Mass is a time to hear Scriptures
proclaimed and lived out mysteries of our faith.

C248344FFCE649E9BE0CE37CB5E3D9EB.description:
Identify Sunday as the Lord’s Day, the “Sabbath”
and we participate in Mass to worship, praise and thank
God.

00CD70598C5C4C7682057088179D58C4.description:
Understand liturgy as the public worship of the
Church and calls everyone to active participation.

38D2D6111AC44AA2B82024CE720C5DFE.description:
EUCHARIST
Who, How, When, and Where
the Mass is Celebrated
[1135-1167, 1322-1419]
Scripture
Ex. 16:1-35
Mt. 26:25-30
Mk. 14:12-26
Lk. 22:14-20
1 Cor. 11:23-27

C74231682FD34A908667CE523E172BD8.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 2 – LITURGICAL EDUCATION: Students recognize the presence of Christ and enter into communion with Him through active, full and conscious
participation in the Liturgical celebrations and Sacraments of the Church.

3EE00CCB0D0D459EBB0C51AC1AD17F9F.description:
Know how the creed helps maintain the
essential concepts of our faith.

49EB1B0B57184AB49AAD70739E5B2093.description:
THE CREED, A
STATEMENT OF OUR BELIEF
[185-1065]
Scripture
Gen. 2:17
Rom. 6:23
2. Tim. 1:9-10

1B8D04B02F3F4AEC819D8084105CCCBC.description:
Know that Trinity is a model of relationship with
God and for us.

171F91EEB70D4D148B1AAAFA55F12584.description:
Identify Christian faith as Trinitarian, and that
this is unique to Christian faith.

3EE19BA64AEC4DC4BA364202188946C4.description:
Name God as Trinity: Father, Son and Holy
Spirit and distinguish the roles of the Holy Trinity as
Creator, Redeemer and Sanctifier.

3D545D2D83B84E3595C2EB773E02F5D4.description:
TRINITY:
GOD THE CREATOR,
JESUS THE REDEEMER, AND
HOLY SPIRIT AS SANCTIFIER
[249-324]
Scripture:
Gen. 1:20-31
Mt. 28:16-20
Mk. 1:9-11
Lk 3:21-22
Rom. 8:26-27

0A01E69D7C55409784CD6E9C3167D0C3.description:
Recall that Jesus died to save us from sin
and death.

59777CDFD7E84B9581274EA3C158CD5F.description:
Locate stories in the New Testament in which
Jesus forgave someone.

A082BF69B26C4028A4A72CAF9ECB30A0.description:
Recall that God the Father sent God the
Son, Jesus Christ as our Redeemer.

64EFED26D83F429D8DF98BC51AF57E2A.description:
Identify Jesus within the Jewish tradition,
including the connection between the Paschal meal
(Passover) and the Paschal mystery.

79D71CC4581D4484BC1527D4FE08D933.description:
Identify God’s chosen people as the
descendants of Abraham, which is the common heritage
of Jews, Christians and Muslims.

E91C8A15CFF047BF981CDBE1D2914FF0.description:
Understand God’s covenants across
salvation history and how God has always been faithful:
e.g. Noah, Abraham, Moses and David.

548C3CBB572D44418D866856F5B80984.description:
Salvation History
[50-73]
Scripture:
Genesis
Exodus
John 3:16-18

D3B494C21DE24BC981BEFF5D65CD0B7E.description:
Locate stories in the New Testament in
which Jesus forgave someone.

C9A854C12CC4484EB7973B2A214C664D.description:
Show understanding that Christians receive
the blessings of the covenant through Christ who
showed us how to live.

752CDC1D342B4F079B1755A8E754B363.description:
Locate selected Biblical passages that have
become guidelines for living a moral life.

652C98D2F3024327B14ABE8C04D19CEE.description:
Define evangelist and know the names of the
four evangelists who wrote the Gospels.

22B254A981334B1591640F3085CA242D.description:
Identify psalms that speak of God’s mercy
and forgiveness of sin.

49F0F2547C7245A9A5CFC106C66EA7E1.description:
Recognize the psalms as the prayers of
Jewish and Christian people.

736186FF42B2491B8C9680116E65EAC0.description:
Identify the first five books of the Old
Testament as the Pentateuch, the Jewish Torah.

7D7F8C9DB140419A87CFA2B3EA99CF62.description:
Recall that God reveals Himself fully by
sending us his own Divine Son, Jesus Christ.

F74EDCF194B54DB8BC55717E4A4B0401.description:
Know that all creation is a gift from God, the
Creator.

BCAA70C9ED364FD3A9D706519BC71518.description:
Recall how God desires to reveal Himself to us
in Scripture and Tradition.

3D4A199E27274516B2FA74E7E42720B3.description:
Recognize that God’s revelation includes
natural law, which is written in the hearts of every person
to help them to do good and avoid evil.

43DA2B49852A4EC3B17D2868B2D78F9E.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1 – KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
